title: Task 32

question.text: What does James imply when he says, I'll try some of these tips.?

answers.answer: He plans to try some of Sarah's habits in the future
He tried some of Sarah's habits in the past
answers.feedback: I'll indicates a future action, not something that has already happened.
The use of I'll suggests a future intention, not something happening currently.

answers.answer: He has no intention of trying Sarah's habits
answers.feedback: James's statement I'll try indicates a plan or intention to try them, contradicting this option.

dialogue.text: Thanks for sharing, Sarah. I'll try some of these tips.

description:
You probably remember that I'll is the contracted form of I will, a modal verb used to express future intentions, decisions, or plans made at the moment of speaking. For example:

I'll call you tomorrow. (future intention to call) I'll take the bus to work. (decision made about taking the bus)
